results.title: Violence against women as a men's issue
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Adam Hasandedic
results.brief_description: One 40 year-old “black sheep” coming to terms with his life - finding his way from trauma as his teacher through to love as his new mentor.

results.title: Safe harbours
results.brief_description: Herself an immigrant, Karen Adams reflects on how policies and attitudes have changed towards immigrants and, in particular, refugees. A memorial at Otaki reminds her of the potential for hospitality and the dangerous journey that refugees take in the desperate search for safe harbours.
results.description: Herself an immigrant, Karen Adams reflects on how policies and attitudes have changed towards immigrants and, in particular, refugees. A memorial at Otaki reminds her of the potential for hospitality and the dangerous journey that refugees take in the desperate search for safe harbours.

results.title: An Album of sunny memories: for Delcie
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Dale Williamson and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dale Williamson provides rich detail of the life of her mother Delcie. From Victory Girl in her beloved Cygnet in Tasmania to wife and mother of four children, Delcie has led a life of simple joys and familial love.
results.title_for_label: An Album of sunny memories: for Delcie

results.title: Love : earned or learned
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Paul O'Toole and ACMI
results.brief_description: Paul O’Toole’s children are the catalyst for love in his family. Having never experienced unconditional love with his own dad, O’Toole has found that love with his own children. They also lead him on many adventures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Paul O’Toole and ACMI

results.title: Vocational indecision
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Leanne Beattie and ACMI
results.brief_description: Leanne Beattie takes us down the long path to finding her ideal career. It is not always something that comes to you during your school years, and maybe not for a long time after that, but sometimes, when you just focus on what you enjoy, eventually you find it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Leanne Beattie and ACMI

results.title: A Story on purpose
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Kaylene Tyler and ACMI
results.brief_description: In a sad reflection on the death of her older brother, Kaylene Tyler remembers the times they spent together when they were children. What reverberates is the sense of waste when a life is taken too soon, when the depths of potential has failed to be realised.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Kaylene Tyler and ACMI
results.description: In a sad reflection on the death of her older brother, Kaylene Tyler remembers the times they spent together when they were children. What reverberates is the sense of waste when a life is taken too soon, when the depths of potential has failed to be realised.

results.title: We shall remember them
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, John Thompson and ACMI
results.brief_description: John Thompson remembers the generations of soldiers that have passed through the Australian Light Horse Memorial Park in Seymour. While honouring their memory, he also welcomes the restoration of the park to create a place of beauty for all future Australians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, John Thompson and ACMI

results.title: Living in & belonging to a place
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Barbara Pater and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Pater provides some insight into what it is like to have an acquired brain injury. Some people want to retreat from the world and some join their local community group but all struggle to restore a sense of dignity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Barbara Pater and ACMI
results.description: Barbara Pater provides some insight into what it is like to have an acquired brain injury. Some people want to retreat from the world and some join their local community group but all struggle to restore a sense of dignity.
